sense.name: a change
sense.commentary: A correct of abuses or malpractices, usually in reference to law, a social system, or an institution
sense.examples: The reforms he proposed were too radical for the politicians. The program of economic reform proved successful. A bureaucratic reform ended much of the company's paperwork.

sense.name: change self
sense.commentary: Self-improvement in behavior or morals by abandoning some vice
sense.examples: The family rejoiced in the drunkard's reform.
